badges.column_description: User Id; the unique id of the user
the badge name the user obtained
the date that the user obtained the badge

comments.column_description: Post Id; the unique id of the post

comments.value_description: commonsense evidence: The score is from 0 to 100. The score more than 60 refers that the comment is a positive comment. The score less than 60 refers that the comment is a negative comment.

comments.column_description: the detailed content of the comment
Creation Date; the creation date of the comment
User Id; the id of the user who post the comment
User Display Name; user's display name

postHistory.column_description: Post History Type Id; the id of the post history type
Post Id; the unique id of the post
Revision GUID; the revision globally unique id of the post
Creation Date; the creation date of the post
User Id; the user who post the post
the detailed content of the post
User Display Name; user's display name

postLinks.column_description: Creation Date; the creation date of the post link
Related Post Id; the id of the related post
Link Type Id; the id of the link type

posts.column_description: the post id
Post Type Id; the id of the post type
Accepted Answer Id; the accepted answer id of the post
Creation Date; the creation date of the post
the score of the post
View Count; the view count of the post
posts.value_description: commonsense evidence: Higher view count means the post has higher popularity

posts.column_description: the body of the post
Owner User Id; the id of the owner user
Last Activity Date; the last activity date
the title of the post
the tag of the post
Answer Count; the total number of answers of the post
Comment Count; the total number of comments of the post
Favorite Count; the total number of favorites of the post
posts.value_description: commonsense evidence: more favorite count refers to more valuable posts.

posts.column_description: Last Editor User Id; the id of the last editor
Last Edit Date; the last edit date
Community Owned Date; the community owned date
the id of the parent post
posts.value_description: commonsense evidence: If the parent id is null, the post is the root post. Otherwise, the post is the child post of other post.

posts.column_description: Closed Date; the closed date of the post
posts.value_description: commonsense evidence: if ClosedDate is null or empty, it means this post is not well-finished if CloseDate is not null or empty, it means this post has well-finished.

posts.column_description: Owner Display Name; the display name of the post owner
Last Editor Display Name; the display name of the last editor

tags.column_description: Tag Name; the name of the tag
the count of posts that contain this tag
tags.value_description: more counts --> this tag is more popular

tags.column_description: Excerpt Post Id; the excerpt post id of the tag
Wiki Post Id; the wiki post id of the tag

users.value_description: commonsense evidence: The user with higher reputation has more influence.

users.column_description: Creation Date; the creation date of the user account
Display Name; the user's display name
Last Access Date; the last access date of the user account
Website Url; the website url of the user account
About Me; the self introduction of the user
Account Id; the unique id of the account
Profile Image Url; the profile image url

votes.column_description: Post Id; the id of the post that is voted
Vote Type Id; the id of the vote type
Creation Date; the creation date of the vote
User Id; the id of the voter
Bounty Amount; the amount of bounty
